alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 1:18PM MDT until August 26 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Kane County in southern Utah... * Until 415 PM MDT. * At 118 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Buckskin Gulch, The Wave, and the Lower Paria River. Up to 0.5 inches of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyons. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Kane County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
